definition: (of a title, degree etc) illegitimately conferred
pinyin: ming2 bu5 zheng4 yan2 bu5 shun4

definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
in a way that justifies the use of the term/genuine/proper/in a way that conforms to logic/justifiable/appropriate/perfectly legitimate
lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification
lit. has a name but no reality (idiom); exists only in name/nominal
lit. to have sufficient reason to send troops (idiom)/to do something with good reason/to have just cause
to be in a position of power
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
